TopicTitle: Hybrid adjustment to my old SSTO launch system

Articles.Content:
I play totally stock hard mode so cost of launch matters to me.

So pre 1.0 I had an SSTO plane that would nicely deliver s decent payload to Minmas and return or alternatively also did Gilly and Ike landing returns (Duna was a tough place to fly in). With refuelling on the runway I once did a Minmas run, followed by Gilly, followed by Ike. 

Currently in 1.0 my SSTO can carry a small payload into orbit and return. I can see maybe a Mun orbit and return but that would be about max.

So changes were in order.

Currently I am having great success with a modified system (not SSTO). Basically I am strapping wings and jets on a rocket and doing most of the launch that way with a breakaway rocket after I drain off the last of the fuel in the wings.

Even with a small 2 jet 1 rocket setup I am easily and cheaply lifting 3,500 DV plus a bit of payload in LKO. For me this is great because it makes Duna, Ike, Dres, Gilly return missions cheaper than my conventional Mun orbit missions were all on small rocket designs.

Anybody else having good luck with hybrids?

Nah, I just do pure SSTO.

But they might be kind of hard to get the design right without revert flight (unless you just do it in sandbox, and then move the craft file to your career game).

> I can see maybe a Mun orbit and return but that would be about max.

I have a tanker SSTO for refuels, including over half an orange tank at Mun orbit, and an even larger SSTO at the dimension and mass limits of the lvl2 runway - but no pics at the moment

I experimented with doing a 2 stage craft, with a jet stage going suborbital, with some fuel to return to the runway, and then a 2nd stage for orbital insertion, that would then be recoverable.... but... I found the staging complexity, alterations to flight profile, and then return of the orbital insertion stage to make a pure SSTO simply better.

But that lead to this behemoth, with over a 33% payload fraction.

![11110187_10103556943613313_4928631009340909867_n.jpg?oh=e1ceddaf233240c38bc7ad618ca3f82f&oe=55C44F3C&__gda__=1443255946_eef6133fbfebe21fc2168f67fffeab43](https://fbcdn-sphotos-f-a.akamaihd.net/hphotos-ak-xtp1/v/t1.0-9/s720x720/11110187_10103556943613313_4928631009340909867_n.jpg?oh=e1ceddaf233240c38bc7ad618ca3f82f&oe=55C44F3C&__gda__=1443255946_eef6133fbfebe21fc2168f67fffeab43)

I think I could do more optimization by replacing some of those rapiers with turbos, and maybe some more efficient rocket engines - rapier closed cycle is pretty bad, and the nukes are weak and barely change the mass fraction to orbit,

![13723_10103556942001543_6078544185263135493_n.jpg?oh=fc6d9d1f92cfba80b592c0889f14c8fc&oe=55C2FE83](https://scontent-mxp1-1.xx.fbcdn.net/hphotos-xaf1/v/t1.0-9/13723_10103556942001543_6078544185263135493_n.jpg?oh=fc6d9d1f92cfba80b592c0889f14c8fc&oe=55C2FE83)

Anyway, I got too obsessed with proving people wrong by taking my designs to Mun and Minmus (not minmas... even though it may be inspired by Mimas).

SSTOs normally should not go beyond LKO.

I recently posted a thread (pseudo)complaining about the effect on my finances if they did .... lots of assets tied up on long transit times.

Haul a payload to LKO with a SSTO, then detach it, and let a nuclear ferry take it somewhere else.

Or... the payload takes care of its own propulsion (as many of my probes do in the small mk2 cargo bay designs), but the SSTO uses some of its fuel to boost the payload into an eliptical orbit (being careful to save enough to aerobrake and land safely).

My SSTOs will not be leaving LKO from now on, except in the form of a self-launching laythe "lander".
